intro: Hippomarathrum bocconei var. brachylobum, commonly known as the Sierra foothill lily, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This variety is part of the Amaryllidaceae family and is noted for its ecological importance in its native range.
